subject: RE: [junit] Help Need!!! Urgent!I would like to test a method repeatedly with various inputs
msgSnippet: ... For me, something like this would work (WARNING: Untested code!). I m pretending that parse() counts whitespace-separated bits, but obviously it could do
messageBody:
> public boolean parse(String param).
> I wanna test this method repeatedly with variaous types of input in
> my JUunit class.
> I have tried calling
> assertEquals(boolean, o.parset("Hello")) in a loop, but it worked for
> only first iteration.
>
> I tried calling the same multiple times then also same problem..

For me, something like this would work (WARNING: Untested code!).
I'm pretending that parse() counts whitespace-separated bits, but
obviously it could do anything.

public class FooTest extends TestCase {
static final String[] sampleStrings = {
"Hello", "Sample With Four Words", "", "Contains\nNewline",
"With TwoSpaces", "With \n Mixed_Whitespace"
}
static final int expectedResult = {
1, 4, 0, 2,
2, 2
}

public void testParse() {
assertEquals( sampleStrings.length, expectedResult.length );
Foo foo = new Foo();
for (int i=0; i<sampleStrings.length; i++) {
int result = foo.parse(sampleStrings[i]);
assertEquals(result, expectedResult[i]);
}
}

}

-- Michael Chermside
